thread.title: Teacher Caught Giving Students Instructional Information on Resisting ICE
thread.title_full: Teacher Caught Giving Students Instructional Information on Resisting ICE

title: Teacher Caught Giving Students Instructional Information on Resisting ICE
text:
As ICE Raids Begin, Parents Shocked by Immigrants’ Rights Fliers Children Bring Home From School 
The school district’s attorney rebuked the educators, reminding them of what their position entails and, more importantly, what it does not. 
“An employee, staff member, teacher, or administrator may not speak to political affiliation, views, protests, advocacy or other controversial issues or topics that may arise while on district property, whether that is in a classroom or in an administrative building, working as a district employee, or using district resources,” the memo stated. 
Reportedly, the pamphlets were handed out to over 3,000 members of Education Austin to be given to their students as a result of ICE officers beginning Operation Cross Check, a program that on Monday resulted in in 51 arrests of illegal immigrants in the Austin area, according to the American Statesman . Of these, 23 people had criminal convictions, some for violent crime. Advertisement – story continues below 
According to TheBlaze , Education Austin trustees Jayme Mathias, Paul Saldaña and Ann Teich attended a news conference located outside of Lanier High School speaking in favor of illegal immigrant students. They are believed to be putting pressure on district board members to adopt a resolution that will make the school district resemble a “sanctuary district,” similar to the “sanctuary cities” Texas Gov. Greg Abbott is cracking down on. 
“We are in a difficult position for our students, our families and our staff,” Teich said. “Many of our immigrant students are operating in and out of school in an atmosphere of fear. Their learning is impacted because of this fear … it is the responsibility of trustees and all AISD staff to ensure that hate does not dominate the lives of our students. To that end, I believe it is the responsibility of trustees and all of our staff to ensure our students and their families are equipped with the information that combats bullying, hate and fear.” 
President Donald Trump made it very clear that illegal immigration is a problem that he fully intends to deal with, and Texas Gov. Abbot has said that his state “will comply” with immigration laws. Advertisement - story continues below
